intro: Minuartia campestris subsp. campestris, commonly known as the field sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as sandy soils, roadsides, and gravelly areas. It is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh, arid environments.
